Your gas company then...
and now

Southwest Gas provides natural gas service to more than 1.8 million customers every year. This growth, while impressive, took time to achieve. Over 80 years of rich history has made us who we are today. As you will see, we couldn't have done it without youâ€¦
our valued customers.

Amidst a Great Depression, a new fuel company is born.

1931

A tale of two high desert communities

Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipisicing elit, sed do eiusmod tempor incididunt ut labore et dolore magna aliqua. 1951

Southwest Gas Corporation became a publicly owned company

on January 24, 1956, with the sale of 44,208 shares of common stock to the public

Southwest Gas acquires Natural Gas Service of Arizona

serving Pinal and Greenlee Counties. Nevada Southern Gas merges into Southwest Gas.

1956

1957

Hello, Las Vegas.

Our corporate headquarters moves from Los Angeles, CA to Las Vegas, NV

1958

class='ar text-left'>Assets of Big Bear Lake Gas Company acquired

Expansion into Northern Nevada and Reno

The completion of the 250-mile pipeline allowed Southwest Gas to expand into northern Nevada, bringing natural gas service to Carson City and South Lake Tahoe. Gas service to Reno commenced January 17

class='ar text-left'> Transmission pipelines to Elko and the South Shore of Lake Tahoe were completed

1959

1963

1965

Transmission pipeline to North Shore of Lake Tahoe

Transmission pipeline to the North Shore of Lake Tahoe was completed. It was extended the following year along the California shore south to Tahoma

1967

SWG rings the Bell on the NYSE

July 19, Southwest's common stock was sold on the New York Stock Exchange for the first time. Southwest Gas purchases the natural gas assets of Tucson Gas & Electric, nearly doubling the company's customer count overnight

Southwest Gas became the first natural gas company to offer common stock to its customers through a customer stock purchase plan. More than 3,400 customers became shareholders in the first four months of the program

The company moved into a new general headquarters on Spring Mountain Road in Las Vegas

1979

1981

1974

Harold G. Laub LNG Plant completed in Lovelock, NV

The plant is the largest single construction project in the company's history. The plant continues to provide peaking capacity for the company's northern Nevada system.

1982

Paiute Pipeline Company was formed to own and operate the northern Nevada transmission facilities regulated by the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission (FERC). The creation of Paiute was prompted by FERC policy initiatives to convert interstate pipelines from gas sellers to gas transporters

Howdy, Arizona!

Southwest Gas acquires the natural gas properties of Arizona Public Service, again nearly doubling the customer count

Paiute commenced operations on August 1, 1988

class='ar text-left'> The company acquired CP National's gas operations in Henderson and Green Valley, Nevada, and Needles, California

1984

1987

1988

1991

class='ar text-right left-drop'> 100,000 customers

In late October, the Southern California Division celebrated its 100,000th customer. The company is one of the largest businesses in the high desert employing nearly 170 people and adding nearly $9 million a year to the local economy through its payroll. In addition, Southwest pays $1.8 million in state and local taxes, and spends nearly $9 million a year on new pipe and equipment to meet the demands for future growth.

class='ar text-right left-drop-2'> We're 75!

Southwest Gas celebrates its 75th anniversary and initiates electronic meter reading conversion project to increase accuracy and efficiency

class='text-left right-drop'> Expansion into Truckee, CA

The company reached a milestone of serving one million customers. A multi-year construction project was initiated to expand the company's northern California service territory into Truckee, California, and portions of Eldorado and Placer Counties

In March, Southwest Gas celebrated its 70th anniversary. It now serves nearly 1.4 million customers in Arizona, California and Nevada, and has approximately 2,500 employees.

1999

2006

1995

2001

Southwest Gas surpasses 1.8 million customers.

Approximately 80 percent of customer meters now being read electronically

2007

class='ar text-right left-drop'> Electronic meter reading conversion project completed one year ahead of schedule

Southwest Gas celebrates its 80th anniversary

Southwest Gas remains strong despite nation's economic downturn. Ends year with 1,824,000 residential, commercial, industrial and other natural gas customers

2008

2011

2009
